author: R Vimal Kumar
text:
PMK leader Anbumani Ramadoss on Tuesday said that his party, if voted to power, would allocate Rs. 50,000 crore exclusively for irrigation schemes across the State which include Athikadvau- Avinashi Flood Flow Canal Scheme.

After visiting the activists, who were on an indefinite fast in support of Athikadavu- Avinashi scheme at Avinashi on Tuesday, he said that the PMK would also be creating separate ministries for irrigation and also horticulture.

He slammed the successive State Governments for not implementing the Athikadavu - Avinashi scheme after making promises on many occasions.

“It is very much a State scheme. The Centre intervention is needed only when it comes to financial assistance and environment clearances”, he pointed out.

Mr. Anbumani complimented the activists supporting the Athikadavu - Avinashi scheme for turning their agitations into a mass movement.

However, he requested the activists to give up fast on the grounds of health. “I appreciated their efforts but they could opt for other forms of agitation considering their deteriorating health”, he said.

Anti-nuclear energy activist S. P. Udayakumar held interactions with the activists supporting the project at Avinashi on Tuesday Kongunadu Janayaga Katchi founder G. K. Nagaraj sounded his disappointment that no financial allocation was made towards meeting the projected expenditure of Athikadavu- Avinashi scheme.
title: Anbumani promises separate ministry for irrigation
